description: Threatening to physically harm or kill another, causing fear.
Willfully threatening death or great bodily injury, causing sustained fear.
Restricting a person's freedom of movement without legal justification.
Unlawful act of enacting violence or abuse on a domestic partner or family member.
Willfully engaging in an activity that endangers the life or property of another.
Unlawful attempt to touch or injure another person, or intentionally placing them in fear of injury.
Unlawful use of force or violence against another person, causing physical harm.
Unlawful intentional and reckless use of force or violence, resulting in serious bodily injury.
Unlawful use of force or violence against a Government Employee.
Unlawful use of force or violence against a Judge.
Stealing property valued at less than $5,000.
Unlawfully entering or remaining concealed in a building with intent to commit a crime.
Obtaining services by deception or unlawful means without compensating the provider.
Possession of loose, rolled, marked, or inked monies in relation to certain offenses.
Possession of items issued and accessible only in SASP armories to SASP or state employees.

offense: Possession of Items Used in the Commission of a Crime
description: Possession of items that could aid in the commission of certain offenses, or possession of a still for liquor manufacture.
Impersonating another person that could make them civilly or criminally liable.
Fraudulent use or possession of another person's identifying information.
Possessing a governmental employee's badge or other identifying information that does not belong to the individual.
Knowingly or designedly defrauding any other person of money, labor, or property by false representation.
Possessing or creating any false government document or false currency.
Knowingly entering or remaining unlawfully in or upon private property.
Intentionally defacing, destroying, or damaging any property that does not belong to the individual.
Possessing any physical property that is reported and reasonably believed to be stolen.
Making a request for emergency response when no actual emergency exists, or reporting a false crime.
Conspiring to commit any crime with one or more people, and one of them commits an overt act in furtherance of that agreement.
Willfully disobeying or not complying with the terms written in any court-issued order.
Failure to Appear in Court when summoned.
Using physical force or willfully absconding to prevent arrest, handcuffing, or being taken to jail or prison.
Engaging in behavior intending to cause public inconvenience.
Unlawful act of reporting a false or nonexistent crime.
Intimidating or pressuring another person aggressively with unwelcome words, deeds, actions, or gestures.
Recklessly or with criminal negligence hindering the discovery, apprehension, conviction, or punishment of a person who committed a crime.
Participating in an event/assembly which results in violent conduct or creates a risk of causing public harm with a group of at least four people.
Knowingly hiding a criminal with an active warrant or who has escaped police custody.
Possession of a controlled/dangerous substance or untaxed alcohol within specified amounts.
Offering, for payment, the services of prostitution or offering payment for prostitution.
Solicitation made in person for immediate donation of money or other gratuity by vocal or nonvocal appeal, including badgering, harassment, threats, or demands.
Hindering Medical or Fire personnel in the performance of their duties.
Unlawful drawing or exhibition of a deadly weapon in the presence of another person not in self-defense, or otherwise displaying a weapon in public without a legal reason.

offense: Unlawful Discharge of a Stun Gun or Deleterious Agent
description: Unlawful act of knowingly discharging any electrical stun gun, propelled bean bag, tear gas, or similar agent against another person without cause.
Unlawful act of willfully or unwillfully discharging a firearm in a negligent manner that could result in injury, death, or property damage.

offense: Possession of Illegal Weapon Modification Device
description: Possessing any weapon modification device that would unlawfully alter any weapon.

offense: Driving While Under the Influence of Drugs or Alcohol
description: Operating a vehicle or bicycle while affected by drug or alcohol intoxication.
Fleeing from a peace officer to avoid apprehension, detention, or arrest while on foot or in a vehicle.
Driving with a willful or wanton disregard for the safety of oneself or others, or in a manner likely to cause injury or death.

offense: Unlawful Use of a Motor Vehicle
description: Taking a vehicle without the owner's consent, without intent to permanently deprive the owner.
Maliciously and intentionally wounding or killing an animal.
The use of any firearm that is not a hunting rifle in the act of hunting.
Illegally killing more than allowed through collecting over the limit of pelts, meat, antlers etc, allowed by the season's stipulations published by the San Andreas Park Rangers.
Illegally catching or possessing more than allowed through collecting over the limit of fish allowed by the season's stipulations published by the San Andreas Park Rangers.
Operating a vehicle involved in an accident resulting in injury, death, or property damage, and leaving the scene without providing identifiable information or rendering aid.
Willfully refusing or failing to comply with a lawful order, signal, or direction of any peace officer.
